title: Pine Forest Biome (WIP)
description: Pine forest biome is a procedural photorealistic forest biome generator, with tons of trees, rocks, saplings, bushes, grasses, plants, forest sounds etc. It also has landscape materials and global foliage actor.
longDescription:
Introducing the Pine Forest Biome Asset Pack! This pack includes high-quality models and 4k textures, allowing you to create stunning, realistic forest environments in no time.

Also these assets are optimized for both performance and visual fidelity. So, Whether you're working on a game, film, or other project, these assets will provide the level of realism and fidelity you need. From trees to lush foliage, this asset pack has everything you need to bring your forest scenes to life.

Whether you're creating a peaceful nature reserve or a dense, dark forest, this asset pack has you covered.


In this asset pack, you'll find trees, saplings, plants, rocks, and other environmental elements to populate your forests. We've also included demo scenes to help you get started quickly. This asset pack also has a global foliage actor to control the most important settings.


Asset List:

Trees: 9

Apple Mint: 5

Cover Branches: 7

Cover Leaves: 4

Fern: 4

Medium Rocks: 6

Grass: 8

Blueprints: 1

Ground Materials: 12

Textures: 165

Ambient Sound Effects: 4

Post Process Materials: 3


Pine Forest Biome supports NANITE and LUMEN for maximum quality with lowest performance cost.
technicalDetails:
Features:

  • All meshes are NANITE (UE5.1 and Above)
  • LOD (level of detail) models to optimize performance on lower-end devices
  • 4k photorealistic models and textures
  • Highly detailed and optimized for use in real-time rendering
  • Suitable for creating realistic, immersive forest environments for games, films, and other projects
  • Variety of terrain textures and materials to add realism and diversity to your forest scenes
  • Dynamic wind animations for trees and plants
  • Procedurally generated water puddles
  • Regular updates to add new models and features to the asset pack
  • 4 SQKM example map


Requirements:

This asset pack uses NANITE and LUMEN. A RTX Graphics Card is recommended, use a RTX 2060 Super at least.

Also, you may need to enable the Procedural Foliage option in the Editor Preference to use the Procedural Generation.

(Edit > Editor Preference... > General > Experimental > Foliage > Procedural Foliage)


Number of Unique Meshes: 48

Collision: Yes-Per Poly

Vertex Count: 624000-365000 (Nanite Trees), 2500-1000 (Medium Assets)

LODs: Yes (1-5 Levels of LOD)

Number of Materials: 8

Number of Material Instances: 19

Number of Material Functions: 32

Number of Textures: 165

Texture Resolutions: Mostly 4096x4096

Platforms Tested: PC
